greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Decimal expansion of 36/Pi^4.
comment: Ernesto Cesaro asserted that lim n -> infinity A002321(n)/n = 36/Pi^4 using a fallacious argument. In fact this limit equals zero.
reference: Ernesto Cesaro, Sur diverses questions d'arithmetique. Mem. Soc. Roy. Sci. Liege 10 (1883), 1-350. Reprinted in Opere Scelte I, Vol. 1, pp. 10-362.
Wladyslaw Narkiewicz, The development of prime number theory: from Euclid to Hardy and Littlewood, Springer-Verlag, New York, 2000, p. 31.
program: (PARI) default(realprecision, 105); x=360/Pi^4; for(n=1, 105, d=floor(x); x=(x-d)*10; print1(d, ", "));
results.author: _Arkadiusz Wesolowski_, Oct 09 2013
